entry.et: Middle English, from Old English rēad; akin to Old High German rōt red, Latin ruber & rufus, Greek erythros

def.dt: :of the color red
:having red as a distinguishing color
:flushed especially with anger or embarrassment
:ruddy florid
:being or having skin of a coppery hue
:bloodshot eyes red from crying
:being in the color range between a moderate orange and russet or bay
:tinged with red :reddish
:heated to redness :glowing
:inciting or endorsing radical social or political change especially by force
:communist
:of or relating to a communist country and especially to the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics
:tending to support Republicans in a general election red states
:characterized by or displaying brutal emotion or violent behavior
:a color whose hue resembles that of blood or of the ruby or is that of the long-wave extreme of the visible spectrum
:red clothing the lady in red
:one that is of a red or reddish color: as
:red wine
:an animal with a red or reddish coat
:a pigment or dye that colors red
:a shade or tint of red
:one who advocates the violent overthrow of an existing social or political order
:communist
def.set: from the bookkeeping practice of entering debit items in red ink
def.dt: :the condition of showing a loss usually used with the in the red compare black
river 1018 miles (1638 kilometers) flowing E on Okla.-Tex. boundary & into the Atchafalaya & Mississippi in Louisiana
river N cen United States & S cen Canada flowing N on Minn.-N.Dak. boundary & into Lake Winnipeg in Manitoba
river 500 miles (805 kilometers) SE Asia rising in cen Yunnan, China, & flowing SE across N Vietnam into Gulf of Tonkin
reduce; reduction
:a nymphalid butterfly (Vanessa atalanta) that is common in both Europe and America, has broad orange-red bands on the forewings, and feeds chiefly on nettles in the larval stage
:the final stage of alert in which enemy attack appears imminent
:a state of alert brought on by impending danger
:any of a division (Rhodophyta) of chiefly marine algae that have predominantly red pigmentation
:any of various reddish ants (as the pharaoh ant)
:to subject (as a person or group) to red-baiting
:to engage in red-baiting
:the act of attacking or persecuting as a Communist or as communistic
